Package org.jglfont

Interface JGLFont

All Known Implementing Classes:
JGLFontImpl
public interface JGLFont
A JGLFont ready to be rendered on screen.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getCharacterWidth(int currentCharacter, int nextCharacter)
    Get the width of a single character.
    int
    getCharacterWidth(int currentCharacter, int nextCharacter, float size)
    The same as the getCharacterWidth(int, char) method but takes a scaled size into account.
    int
    getHeight()
    The height of the given font (the lineHeight property of the font data)
    int
    getStringWidth(String text)
    Returns the width of the given String.
    int
    getStringWidth(String text, float size)
    The same as the getStringWidthInternal(String) method that takes the given size into account.
    void

    Output text at the given x and y positon.

    Output text at the given x and y position using the given color and the r,g,b,a components.
    void
    setCustomRenderState(Object customRenderState)
    Allows to transfer custom data to the FontRenderer.

  • Method Details

    • renderText

      void renderText(int x, int y, String text)
      Output text at the given x and y positon. White will be used for the complete text.
      Parameters:
      x - x position
      y - y position
      text - text to output

    • renderText

      void renderText(int x, int y, String text, float sizeX, float sizeY, float r, float g, float b, float a)
      Output text at the given x and y position using the given color and the r,g,b,a components.
      Parameters:
      x - x position
      y - y position
      text - the text to output
      sizeX - x scale factor of the text (this should be apply with x,y as the origin)
      sizeY - y scale factor of the text (this should be apply with x,y as the origin)
      r - red
      g - green
      b - blue
      a - alpha

    • getCharacterWidth

      int getCharacterWidth(int currentCharacter, int nextCharacter)
      Get the width of a single character.
      Parameters:
      currentCharacter - current character
      nextCharacter - next character
      Returns:
      the width of the character when followed by the given next character

    • getCharacterWidth

      int getCharacterWidth(int currentCharacter, int nextCharacter, float size)
      The same as the getCharacterWidth(int, char) method but takes a scaled size into account.

    • getStringWidth

      int getStringWidth(String text)
      Returns the width of the given String.
      Parameters:
      text - the text
      Returns:
      the width

    • getStringWidth

      int getStringWidth(String text, float size)
      The same as the getStringWidthInternal(String) method that takes the given size into account.

    • getHeight

      int getHeight()
      The height of the given font (the lineHeight property of the font data)
      Returns:

    • setCustomRenderState

      void setCustomRenderState(Object customRenderState)
      Allows to transfer custom data to the FontRenderer. The instance you provide here will be set in the beforeRender() method of the FontRenderer.
      Parameters:
      customRenderState - this instance will be forwarded to the fontRenderer.beforeRender() method
